timings: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM for regular visitor operations
nearest_railway: Helem Railway Station (~depends on range); major junctions are Furkating / Golaghat / Nagaon
nearest_airport: Jorhat Airport (for Central Range) / Tezpur Airport (for Western)
accessibility: Good roads to major entrances; internal tracks may be rough; not particularly wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Yes — forest department approved guides; safari/elephant ride/jeep safari with permits
parking: Available at entry gates (e.g. Kohora etc.); charges vary
nearby_amenities: Lodges, resorts, restaurants in and around Golaghat / Bokakhat
special_notes: Famous for one-horned rhino; UNESCO World Heritage Site; safari operations sometimes suspended in monsoon

timings: Daily operations; park open throughout the day
nearest_bus: Local bus stands in Tezpur region / Rangapar
accessibility: Access roads up to park entry good; internal trails can be moderate; not very accessible for wheelchair
guided_tours: Yes – local guides / forest department guides; rafting guides
parking: Parking available at entry points; small / basic parking
nearby_amenities: Lodges and guesthouses in Tezpur region; some homestays
special_notes: Famous for birdwatching; rafting on Jia Bhoroli River; tranquil compared to more crowded parks

timings: Morning: 5:30 AM to ~1:00 PM; Afternoon: ~2:30 PM to ~5:30 PM
entry_fee: General / free darshan; VIP / special darshan pass ~ ₹500
best_time: Oct to Mar; festivals like Ambubachi (June), Durga Puja (Sept/Oct) are major but very crowded
nearest_railway: Kamakhya Station (~6-7 km) OR Guwahati Railway Station (~7-8 km)
nearest_airport: Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport, Guwahati (~20 km)
accessibility: Road access good; hill top requires walk/steep steps; difficult during heavy crowds for mobility-impaired
guided_tours: Local priests / “pandas” help with darshan process; many guides operate in Guwahati
parking: Parking available near temple base / on Nilachal Hill; limited during festivals
nearby_amenities: Hotels in Guwahati; eateries, shops, markets
special_notes: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas; Ambubachi Mela is biggest festival when temple is closed for 3 days

category: Natural Lake / Picnic Spot / Eco tourism
timings: Open throughout daylight hours; boating etc available seasonally
entry_fee: Not documented clearly; small boat/rowing charges may apply
nearest_bus: Local bus terminus in Kamrup / Guwahati region
accessibility: Road up to lake region; some forested/uneven paths; not ideal for wheelchair
guided_tours: Local villagers / tourism services may guide
parking: Basic parking at lake entry / nearby village; informal or small charges
nearby_amenities: Basic guesthouses or homestays; local eateries; shops small scale
official_website: Assam Tourism pages / Kamrup district site
special_notes: Lake was formed after 1897 earthquake; cultural festival (Chandubi Festival) in first week of January; migratory birds in winter

category: National Park / Wildlife Sanctuary / Tiger Reserve
timings: 5:30 AM to 6:30 PM approx visitor hours
entry_fee: Indians ~ ₹20; Foreigners ~ ₹250; Safari / Jeep fees etc additional
nearest_railway: Guwahati Railway Station; closer stations like Barpeta Road / Pathsala exist
nearest_bus: Local bus stands in Barpeta / Manas gate towns
nearest_airport: Guwahati Airport is major; also closer small airstrips depending on range
accessibility: Varies by zone; forests; not wheelchair friendly in many parts
guided_tours: Yes – wildlife guides, forest dept, safaris, nature walks
parking: Parking at park entrances; basic facilities
nearby_amenities: Lodges / eco-tourism rest houses near entrances; towns outside offer more services
official_website: Assam Tourism / Manas National Park pages
special_notes: UNESCO Biosphere Reserve; dense biodiversity; riverine landscapes; endangered species; cross-border habitat with Bhutan

timings: Accessible year-round when river ferry is operational; ferry timings vary
entry_fee: Not documented fixed entry fee; Satras may accept donations; boat/ferry charges separately
nearest_railway: Jorhat Railway Station (~approx distance by road + ferry)
nearest_bus: Bus stand in Jorhat / Nimatighat ferry terminal
nearest_airport: Jorhat Airport is the closest by flight; then road + ferry
accessibility: Access involves road + ferry; river crossings can be affected by monsoon; internal roads may be rural / uneven
guided_tours: Local guides and tour operators provide cultural tours
nearby_amenities: Homestays, guesthouses; local eateries; shops; cultural performances
special_notes: Largest river island in the world; major center of Assamese culture and Satriya tradition

category: City / Heritage Town / Scenic & Cultural attractions
entry_fee: For many temples free / donation; parks/gardens small admission fees (e.g. Chitralekha Udyan ~ ₹20)
nearest_railway: Dekargaon Railway Station (~8-14 km) or Rangapara North
nearest_bus: Tezpur ASTC Bus Station; Mission Chariali Bus Stand
accessibility: Good road connectivity; city infrastructure reasonable; some attractions require walking
guided_tours: Local guides available; heritage walks; English / Assamese
parking: City parking available near major temples / parks
nearby_amenities: Hotels, restaurants in Tezpur; shops; cultural centers; tea stalls
special_notes: Tezpur known for myths (Agnigarh), ancient temples, elegant colonial era architecture

timings: Temples & museums / tanks are open daylight
entry_fee: Many heritage sites are free / nominal fee; museums / Ahom monuments may charge small fees
accessibility: Town roads decent; monuments often centrally located; walking required for some
guided_tours: Yes – local history guides; academic/cultural tours
parking: Available in town; near heritage sites / temples
nearby_amenities: Hotels, restaurants, shops; local markets; cultural events
special_notes: Sivasagar was capital of Ahom Kingdom; has famous Rang Ghar, Talatal Ghar, Joysagar Tank etc

timings: Open year-round; attractions open daylight hours
entry_fee: Not applicable (free to visit town / hills; parks may charge small nominal fee)
accessibility: Hill roads; limited wheelchair accessibility; trekking paths for nearby viewpoints
guided_tours: Local guides available for trekking / sightseeing
parking: Available in town centre and at viewpoints
nearby_amenities: Resorts, hotels, guesthouses; restaurants; local markets
special_notes: Assam’s only hill station; known as “Switzerland of the East”

timings: 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM (daily; closed during heavy monsoon)
accessibility: Road till park entry; inside areas accessible by boat safaris & walking trails; not wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Yes – boat tours with naturalists; birdwatching guides available
nearby_amenities: Eco camps, lodges near Guijan & Tinsukia; local eateries and rest houses
special_notes: Known for feral horses, migratory birds, and rich biodiversity; part of Brahmaputra floodplain ecosystem

entry_fee: Free entry in some gardens; guided tours chargeable (~₹200–₹500)
accessibility: Well-paved roads to most gardens; internal paths easy; wheelchair access possible in some estates
guided_tours: Yes – tea estate tours include plantation walks, tea factory visits, tasting sessions
parking: Available in estates; free or included in tour fee
nearby_amenities: Heritage tea bungalows (converted into resorts); restaurants; shops selling Assam Tea
special_notes: Dibrugarh is called the “Tea City of India”; offers tea tasting, heritage bungalows, Assamese & British colonial culture

nearest_airport: Tezpur Airport (~125 km); Guwahati Airport (~180 km)
accessibility: Well-connected by road & rail; within town; not fully wheelchair-friendly inside old structures
guided_tours: Local priests and cultural guides explain Satra history
nearby_amenities: Guesthouses in Hojai; local restaurants; shops
special_notes: Birthplace of Srimanta Sankardev; hub of Assamese Vaishnavism

nearest_bus: Guwahati Bus Terminals (~50 km); Marigaon bus stand (~30 km)
accessibility: Road from Guwahati to Pobitora is good; internal safaris by jeep; not wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Yes – official guides with jeep safaris; English/Hindi/Assamese support
parking: Available at entry gate; nominal charge
nearby_amenities: Eco lodges, homestays; tea stalls; basic eateries
special_notes: High density of one-horned rhinos; birdwatcher’s paradise; smaller & less crowded than Kaziranga

nearest_railway: Jorhat Town Railway Station (~20 km + ferry)
nearest_bus: Jorhat ASTC Bus Stand (~20 km + ferry)
accessibility: Requires ferry from Jorhat; local roads in Majuli
parking: Available near ferry point / satra area
special_notes: Founded in 1653, one of Majuli’s most important satras, known for traditional dance & cultural heritage

accessibility: Road access good; walking trails inside forest
special_notes: Only sanctuary in India dedicated to Hoolock Gibbons; also home to elephants, leopards, and birdlife

category: Historical Monument / Scenic Hill / Cultural Heritage
accessibility: Hilltop park with steps; moderate difficulty for elderly
guided_tours: Not official, but local guides narrate legends
special_notes: Associated with the legend of Usha & Aniruddha (Mahabharata); scenic view of Brahmaputra River

category: Scenic Hill Station / River Valley / Industrial Tourism
timings: Open year-round (restricted zones inside dam area)
nearest_bus: Haflong / Diphu ASTC Bus Stands (~100 km)
guided_tours: Local guides for hill treks & cultural villages
special_notes: Surrounded by green hills, lakes & waterfalls; Karbi culture hub

nearest_railway: Guwahati Railway Station (~4 km from ferry ghat)
accessibility: Accessible only by ferry from Uzan Bazar Ghat
nearby_amenities: Shops, eateries at riverbank; hotels in Guwahati city
special_notes: Smallest inhabited river island in the world; famous for Umananda Temple (Lord Shiva)
